feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Wed, 06 Sep 2023 08:03:30
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Microsoft files a patent on its new AI-powered smart backpack that can hear and see what you see.
- How Amazon uses chaos engineering to handle 80k requests per second.
- iPhone and iPad apps will be available in the Vision Pro App Store by default.

Business:
- Global Medical Publishing Market valued at $9.7 billion in 2022.
- The shrinking number of primary care physicians is reaching a tipping point.
- Lawsuit claims mobile home park managers conspired to fix and inflate lot rental prices.

AI:
- Microsoft files a patent on its new AI-powered smart backpack that can hear and see what you see.

Other:
- Remembering Doug Lenat (1950â€“2023) and his quest to capture the world with logic.
- I got my Amex Platinum for the clout, but I'm educating myself about the risks.
- The Capitol physician said Mitch McConnell's health scares may have been a result of dehydration, but Sen. Rand Paul doesn't believe it.
- Damaged tail rotor to blame for helicopter crash in 2018 that killed Leicester owner and 4 others.
- Air Canada apologizes for booting passengers who complained that their seats were smeared with vomit.
- Burning Man costs most people a minimum of $800 for just a ticket and a parking spot, with additional expenses pushing the total cost into the thousands.
- AOC says Biden must continue his outreach to progressives ahead of the 2024 election, similar to efforts after the 2020 Democratic primary.
- Republicans hired way more ex-lobbyists as congressional staffers in the last year than Democrats, analysis finds.
- Russian pilot who defected with stolen fighter jet spare parts gets $500,000 reward from Ukraine.
- Poor people 'surviving not living' as UK social contract collapses, says report.
- Emerge (YC W21) is hiring a lead front-end engineer (remote, small team).
- Ask HN: Is there a news source you read every day? If so, what is it?
- Elon Musk paid for our attention, but the price to keep it is getting higher.
- These Steam Deck custom resin buttons look phenomenal and are for sale.
- After a historic strike, UC grad students say the university isn't honoring pay agreements.
- As a shutdown looms, will the U.S. Congress cut spending and restrict research?
- 'Ask Sophie' book excerpt: A startup founder's guide to O-1A visas.

Insights:
- The medical publishing market is experiencing significant growth, reaching a value of $9.7 billion in 2022.
- The shortage of primary care physicians is becoming a critical issue.
- Microsoft's new AI-powered smart backpack has the potential to revolutionize the way we interact with technology.
- There is a growing concern about the rising number of cancer cases among younger people, with scientists still unsure of the underlying causes.
- Student loans are a major concern for Gen Z, impacting their career choices.
- The social contract in the UK is collapsing, leading to poor living conditions for many.
- The influence of lobbyists in politics is evident, with Republicans hiring more ex-lobbyists as congressional staffers compared to Democrats.
- The cost of attending events like Burning Man can be substantial, with expenses easily reaching thousands of dollars.
- The need for continued outreach to progressives is emphasized by AOC, highlighting the importance of unity within the Democratic party.
- The impact of technology on our daily lives is evident, with companies like Amazon and Microsoft constantly innovating to handle increasing demands.
- The struggles faced by individuals in low-income communities are highlighted, emphasizing the need for social support and change.
- The importance of honoring agreements and fair treatment of workers is emphasized by the UC grad students' strike.
- The potential consequences of a government shutdown and its impact on spending and research are discussed.
- The challenges faced by startup founders in navigating visa processes are explored in the book excerpt.
